channel.description: Recent content in Too2s on CityU-Bioinformatics

item.title: Bioimaging
item.description: Table of Contents Microscopic Phenotype Analysis Microscopic Image Formats Management Education PheWAS Image Preprocessing Image Acquisition Image Enhancement Image Deconvolution Image processing Image Simulation Image Segmentation Image Registration Laser Scanning Microscopy FISH Colocalization Analysis 3D Image Analysis Conventional Fluorescence microscopy High-throughput Screening Cell Phenotyping Mitochondrial Network Analysis Super-resolution Imaging Morphometric Analysis Single Molecule Detection and Localization FLIM data Analysis FRET Data Analysis Cryo-EM Neuron Tracing Single Particle Analysis Find more tools: OMICTOOLS Microscopic Phenotype Analysis Microscopic phenotype analysis deals with all tools usefull for describing, identifying or classifying phenotypes at microscopic scale.

item.title: DNA Modifications
item.description: Table of Contents DNA modification analysis DNA Methylation Prediction DNA Methylation Deconvolution DNA methylation array analysis Differential Methylation Site Detection Differential Methylation region Detection Enrichment Analysis Over-representation analysis Gene set enrichment analysis Topology enrichment analysis Bisulfite Sequencing Data Analysis (BS-seq analysis) Differential Methylation region Detection Methylation Annotation EWAS Find more tools: OMICTOOLS DNA modification analysis Whole genome DNA methylation detection is one of the most important part of epigenetics research.

item.title: Genome Annotation
item.description: Table of Contents Genome Annotation Gene Ontology Annotation BLASTX Blast2GO GO Semantic Similarity Analysis G-SESAME | Gene Semantic Similarity Analysis and Measurement Tools clusterProfiler | GO semantic similarity analysis : Genome annotation GOToolBox | GO semantic similarity analysis : DNA sequence analysis SML-Toolkit | Semantic Measures Library Toolkit Promoter Predication FirstEF | First Exon Finder CpGpromoter PROmiRNA Annotation Workflows RAST | Rapid Annotation using Subsystem Technology Prokka | Annotation workflows BlastKOALA Find more tools: OMICTOOLS Genome Annotation Genome annotation is a key process for identifying the coding and non-coding regions of a genome, gene locations and functions.

item.title: Metabolic Profiles
item.description: Table of Contents Metabolic profiles analysis Metabolic Network analysis mGWAS Metabolite enrichment analysis MS-based untargeted Metabolomics Metabolic Network analysis mGWAS Metabolite enrichment analysis NMR-based Metabolomics/MS-based targeted metabolomics Spectral corrections Spectral deconvolution Chemometric analysis Metabolite identification Find more tools: OMICTOOLS Metabolic profiles analysis The further development of spectroscopic and spectrometric tools for high throughput analyses of selected biochemical pathways is crucial to the acquisition of metabolome data sets of sufficient quality for metabonomics and metabolomics.

item.title: Protein Sequence/Expression
item.description: Table of Contents Protein Sequence Analysis Amino Acid Repeat Prediction Subcellular Localizaton Prediction T3S effector Prediction Protein Clustering SDS Prediction MS-based (Mass Spectrometry) untargeted Proteomics 2D gel Image Analysis In Silico Analysis Phosphorylation Site Assignment PTM Identification Glycosylation Identification MS-based Metaproteomics Antibody Array Analysis Proteogenomics Analysis Find more tools: OMICTOOLS Protein Sequence Analysis Protein sequence analysis tools are used to predict specific functions, activities, origin, or localization of proteins based on their amino-acid sequence.

item.title: RNA Transcription
item.description: Table of Contents Transcription analysis Prognostic Biomarker Identification Region Discrimination Gene co-expression prediction Gene regulatory network inference Gene set enrichment analysis Over-representation analysisi RNA-seq analysis Read count Known transcript quantification Gene fusion detection Prognostic biomarker identification Differential expression Alternative splicing events identification CAGE Analysis TSS detection De novo motif discovery Gene expression array analysis Differential expression detection Time course Meta-analysis Metatranscriptomic sequencing analysis Prediction-base Taxonomic Homology-Based Taxonomic Find more tools: OMICTOOLS Transcription analysis Transcript abundance is in many ways an extraordinary phenotype, with special attributes that confer particular importance on an understanding of its genetics.

item.title: DNA Structure
item.description: Table of Contents DNA Structure Shape prediction do_x3dna 3DNA DINAMelt DNAshape R-loop forming sequence prediction QmRLFS-finder DNA Structure Database R-loopDB | R-loop forming sequence databases Small-angle Scattering AXES FoXS AquaSAXS Find more tools: OMICTOOLS DNA Structure DNA molecules exist in many different conformations, including A-DNA, B-DNA, or Z-DNA forms, which depend on the nucleotide sequence, hydratation level, presence of metal ions, etc.

item.title: Lipidomics
item.description: Table of Contents Transcription analysis Lipidomics Databases MS-based untargeted lipidomics MS-based targeted lipidomics Find more tools: OMICTOOLS Transcription analysis Transcript abundance is in many ways an extraordinary phenotype, with special attributes that confer particular importance on an understanding of its genetics. The primary transformative potential of genome-wide gene expression genetics is the sheer number of traits — thousands — that can be assayed simultaneously. Lipidomics Databases Development of databases and the related bioinformatics tools has become an essential part of the omics studies.

item.title: Low-level RNA detection
item.description: Table of Contents Low-level RNA detection scRNA-seq analysis Noise reduction Transcript quantification Cell lineage and pseudotime inference Dimensionality reduction Single-cell qPCR dPCR Find more tools: OMICTOOLS Low-level RNA detection scRNA-seq analysis The development of high-throughput RNA sequencing (RNA-seq) at the single-cell level has already led to profound new discoveries in biology, ranging from the identification of novel cell types to the study of global patterns of stochastic gene expression.

item.title: Medical Imaging
item.description: Table of Contents Medical Phrnotype Analysis Clinical Risk Prediction Personal Health Record Analysis Clinical Simulation Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI) Image modelization DICOM files management Computerized Tomography Scan Imaging (CT) Phantom Imaging Image Format Management Nuclear Medicine Imaging 3D Image Reconstruction Kinetic Analysis Ultrasonic Imaging Image Acquisition Image Visualization Find more tools: OMICTOOLS Medical Phrnotype Analysis Macroscopic phenotype analysis deals with all tools usefull for describing, identifying or classifying phenotypes at macroscopic scale.

item.title: Nucleosome Positioning
item.description: Table of Contents Nucleosome Positioning MNase-seq analysis ATAC-seq analysis Find more tools: OMIVTOOLS Nucleosome Positioning MNase-seq analysis The technology of micrococcal nuclease (MNase) digestion combined with high-throughput sequencing (MNase-seq) is a powerful method to map the genome-wide distribution of nucleosome occupancy (Mavrich et al., 2008; Schones et al., 2008; Jiang and Pugh, 2009). Source text: Chen et al., 2014. ATAC-seq analysis ATAC-seq allows simultaneous interrogation of factor occupancy, nucleosome positions in regulatory sites, and chromatin accessibility genome wide by considering the position of insertion and the distribution of insert lengths captured during the transposition reaction.

item.title: Prediction of Protein Structure
item.description: This part may contains the following tools: (Will be filled in the future) Primary structure ProtParam COILS Secondary structure PredictProtein PSIPRED tertiary structure Phyre Swiss-PdbViewer Top Find more tools: OMICTOOLS Image Citation

item.title: Computational Neuroinformatics
item.description: Table of Contents Biological Steps Realistic Neuronal Network Modelling Compartment Neuron modelling File Manipulation Model Files Conversion Model Files Visualization Model Building Database Find more tools: OMICTOOLS Modelling in computational neuroscience is becoming a crucial tool for understanding how experimentally observed properties of neural systems emerge from lower-level biophysical processes. In the same way that processing of information happens at multiple physical scales in the nervous system, software applications have been created which specialize in modelling different aspects of neurons and networks.

item.title: DNA-Protein Interactions
item.description: Table of Contents HT-SELEX Analysis DNase-seq Analysis ChIP-seq Analysis De novo assembly Peak calling Differential peak calling De novo motif discovery Find more tools: OMICTOOLS DNA-binding proteins are proteins that have DNA-binding domains and thus have a specific or general affinity for single- or double-stranded DNA. Sequence-specific DNA-binding proteins generally interact with the major groove of B-DNA, because it exposes more functional groups that identify a base pair.

item.title: Drug Discovery
item.description: Table of Contents Drug Discovery Chemical Enrichment Analysis Drug-drug interaction prediction Ligand-based Virtual Screening Drug Repositioning Chemical Toxicity Molecular editors Find more tools: OMICTOOLS Drug Discovery In the fields of medicine, biotechnology and pharmacology, drug discovery is the process by which new candidate medications are discovered. Historically, drugs were discovered through identifying the active ingredient from traditional remedies or by serendipitous discovery. Later chemical libraries of synthetic small molecules, natural products or extracts were screened in intact cells or whole organisms to identify substances that have a desirable therapeutic effect in a process known as classical pharmacology.

item.title: Genome Editing
item.description: Table of Contents Genome Editing CRISPR/Cas9 sgRNA Design CRISPR design GuideScan E-CRISP CRISPRscan TALEN design TALE-NT TALEN Targeter ZFN Design Zinc Finger Tools ZifNN ZFN-Site CRISPR/Cas9 Screen Analysis CREATE | CRISPR-enabled trackable genome engineering MAGeCK | Model-based Analysis of Genome-wide CRISPR/Cas9 Knockout MAGeCK-VISPR caRpools | CRISPR-AnalyzeR for pooled screens Genome Editing Database Find more tools: OMICTOOLS Genome Editing Programmable nucleases - including zinc-finger nucleases (ZFNs), transcription activator-like effector nucleases (TALENs) and RNA-guided engineered nucleases (RGENs) derived from the bacterial clustered regularly interspaced short palindromic repeat (CRISPR)-Cas (CRISPR-associated) system - enable targeted genetic modifications in cultured cells, as well as in whole animals and plants.

item.title: Immune System
item.description: Table of Contents Immune System Analysis Sequence-based B-cell Epitope Prediction Structure-based B-cell Epitope Prediction Antibody Structure Prediction MHC Class I Epitope Prediction MHC Class II Epitope Prediction Flow Cytometry Cell Population Identification Data Repositories Utilities Mass Cytometry Peptide Array Analysis Find more tools: OMICTOOLS Immune System Analysis Immunoinformatics involves the application of computational methods to immunological problems. Prediction of B- and T-cell epitopes has long been the focus of immunoinformatics, given the potential translational implications, and many tools have been developed.

item.title: RNA Modifications
item.description: Table of Contents RNA Modifications Analysis Protein-binding Region Prediction RNA Editing Prediction Alternative Splicing Annotation RNA Methylation Prediction Methylated RNA Immunoprecipitation Sequencing Data Analysis (MeRIP-seq Analysis) Spliced Read Alignment Peak Calling De novo motif discovery Degradome-seq Analysis Find more tools: OMICTOOLS RNA Modifications Analysis From a biosynthetic point of view, the roughly 100 known different RNA nucleotide modifications can be easily divided according to their complexity.

item.title: Metabolic Engineering
item.description: Table of Contents Biological Steps Constraint based methods Metabolic pathway prediction Strain design Thermodynamics Network Analysis Genome-scale Metabolic Reconstruction 13C-fluxomics Find more tools: OMICTOOLS Growing concerns over limited fossil resources and associated environmental problems are motivating the development of sustainable processes for the production of chemicals, fuels and materials from renewable resources. Metabolic engineering is a key enabling technology for transforming microorganisms into efficient cell factories for these compounds.

item.title: Neorophysiology
item.description: Table of Contents Neurophysiology Analysis Clinical Eletrophysiology Data Acquisition Spike Sorting Image Data Analysis Data Management and Annotation Patch-clamp Find more tools: OMICTOOLS Neurophysiology Analysis Clinical Eletrophysiology Electrophysiology, the ‘gold standard’ for investigating neuronal signalling, is being challenged by a new generation of optical probes. Together with new forms of microscopy, these probes allow us to measure and control neuronal signals with spatial resolution and genetic specificity that already greatly surpass those of electrophysiology.

item.title: Population Genomics
item.description: Table of Contents Popilation Genetic Analysis Pedigree Reconstruction Forward Simulation Population Structure Inference Genotyping by Sequencing data analysis (GBS Analysis) Base Callling Read Quality Contorl Adapter trimming Gerline SNO Detection Somatic SNV detection Restriction Site Associated DNA Sequencing Data Analysis (RAD-seq Analysis) Phylogenetic Inference SNP/SNV Annotation Find more tools: OMICTOOLS Population genomics is the large-scale comparison of DNA sequences of populations.

item.title: Protein Interactions
item.description: Table of Contents Protein Interactions Analysis Protein-DNA Interaction Prediction Protein-RNA Interaction Prediction Pocket Detection Drug-target Interaction Prediction Protein-protein Interaction Prediction Protein-ligand Docking Protein-protein Docking FRET Find more tools: OMICTOOLS Protein Interactions Analysis Proteins interact with nucleic acids, other proteins, ligands, metal ions, to exert their biological functions. Mass-spectrometry and protein chips have revolutionized the field of proteomics and the study of protein interactions to a wider scale, which require specific tools for their analyses.

item.title: RNA-Protein Interactions
item.description: Table of Contents CLIP-seq Analysis Peak Calling Motif Discovery miRNA Target Site Detection Ribo-seq Analysis RNase Footprint Detection Ribosome P-site Localization Ribosome Stalling Prediction Translated ORF Prediction Find more tools: OMICTOOLS CLIP-seq Analysis Cross-Linking Immunoprecipitation associated to high-throughput sequencing (CLIP-seq) is a technique used to identify RNA directly bound to RNA-binding proteins across the entire transcriptome in cell or tissue samples. Recent technological and computational advances permit the analysis of many CLIP-seq samples simultaneously, allowing us to reveal the comprehensive network of RNA-protein interaction and to integrate it to other genome-wide analyses.

item.title: Brain Connectomics
item.description: Table of Contents Connectivity Analysis Functional Brain Connectivity Structural Brain Connectivity Functional Magnetic Resonance Imaging (fMRI) 3D Image Surfacing Diffusion Magnetic Resonance Imaging Analysis Tractography Neuron Tracing Find more tools: OMICTOOLS Connectivity Analysis The functional organization of the brain is characterized by segregation and integration of information being processed. A central paradigm in modern neuroscience is that anatomical and functional connections between brain regions are organized in a way such that information processing is near optimal.

item.title: DNA-Protein Interactions
item.description: Table of Contents HT-SELEX Analysis DNase-seq Analysis ChIP-seq Analysis De novo assembly Peak calling Differential peak calling De novo motif discovery Find more tools: OMICTOOLS DNA-binding proteins are proteins that have DNA-binding domains and thus have a specific or general affinity for single- or double-stranded DNA. Sequence-specific DNA-binding proteins generally interact with the major groove of B-DNA, because it exposes more functional groups that identify a base pair.

item.title: Membrane Protein
item.description: Table of Contents Membrane Protein Analysis Membrane Protein-protein Docking Membrane Simulation Transmembrane Beta-barrel Prediction Transmembrane Helix Prediction Function Membrane Protein FRAP Find more tools: OMICTOOLS Membrane Protein Analysis Membrane and transmembrane proteins are key component of cell signaling. Their configuration, folding, or activity depend on several biochemical factors that can be predicted by specific software. Membrane Protein-protein Docking Membrane Simulation Transmembrane Beta-barrel Prediction Transmembrane Helix Prediction Function Membrane Protein FRAP Top

item.title: Non-Coding RNA
item.description: Table of Contents Non-Coding RNA Analysis miRNA Target Prediction miRNA Enrichment miRNA-disease Association Prediction RNAi Reagent Design High-throughput RNAi Screening Small RNA sequencing Data analysis (sRNA-seq Analysis) tRNA-derived RNA Annotation ncRNA Identification IsomiR detection nvRNA-related SNPS miRNA Array analysis Find more tools: OMICTOOLS Non-Coding RNA Analysis Noncoding RNAs (ncRNAs) accomplish a remarkable variety of biological functions. They regulate gene expression at the levels of transcription, RNA processing, and translation.

item.title: Phylogenetic Data Analysis
item.description: Table of Contents Popilation Genetic Analysis Phylogenetic inference Phylogenetic Network Construction Discrete Character Evolution Tumor Progression Tree Visualization Find more tools: OMIVTOOLS In biology, phylogenetics is the study of the evolutionary history and relationships among individuals or groups of organisms (e.g. species, or populations). These relationships are discovered through phylogenetic inference methods that evaluate observed heritable traits, such as DNA sequences or morphology under a model of evolution of these traits.
